brief_summary.textblock:
This is a feasibility study to demonstrate the team's ability to collect bone marrow
      aspirates and biopsies for research purposes from women with metastatic breast cancer.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study of Bone Biopsy and Aspirate in Women With Metastatic Breast Cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with metastatic breast cancer (any site) age 21 or older

          -  Patients willing and able to provide informed consent & perform study procedures

          -  Patients may enroll with stable, responding or progressive tumor burden

          -  Performance status of 0,1 or 2

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients unable or unwilling to provide informed consent and or perform study
             procedures

          -  Patients with active, uncontrolled coagulopathy

          -  Patients on treatment dose anticoagulation or an International Normalised Ratio of 2
             or greater if on warfarin

          -  Patients who are known to be pregnant are not eligible to participate in this study
             during the time of the pregnancy

clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of Bone Biopsy and Aspirate in Women With Metastatic Breast Cancer

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patient that agree to undergo 2 biopsy's strictly for research purposes.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
